resources.string: The aim of the game is to guess a 5 digit number in 10 guesses or less! \n \n In order to help you, you get feedback based on each guess. Using the feedback you can logically work out the answer.

In order to make it a little easier, there are a few rules. 

 The answer will be between 10,000 and 99,999.
 However, there are no repeating digits. 
 
 For example, 77777 is not a legitimate guess, as '7' is repeated. The same is true for numbers like: 12325, 50985, 57567, etc.

Feedback comes in the form of coloured 'balls'. 
 A green ball indicates you have a correct digit in the correct position. 
 An orange ball indicates you have a correct digit, but in the incorrect position. 
 A red ball indicates you have the wrong digit.

From this guess, we can see that the numbers 3 and 2 are not in the answer. (red balls) \n We can also see that the numbers 7 and 5 are in the answer (orange balls) \n Finally, we can see the last digit in the answer is the number 9 (green ball)

In Hard Mode, you do not get any red balls. You must logically work out which numbers correspond to which balls you received. 
 
 This is a much greater challenge, and is the true form of Flummoxed! 
 Whilst challenging, if you use your guesses wisely, it is possible to always win.

#1 gives us two green balls. As we have no other info, for #2 we keep 3 and 5 in place hoping they are green. 
 However, we lose a green ball, so we are incorrect, and removed a correct digit. 
 From #3, we can now say both 3 and 7 are 'red' and can be dismissed. 
 
 Try it and good luck!
